column1: When at last spring arrived and we returned to Lamington on our Easter vacation
column2: quite a sum of money had been collected
column4: if I remember rightly; at any rate plenty to buy the materials for a good-sized tent and leave a large surplus for provisions
column5: etc. Bill figured out on paper just how much canvas we would need for a tent 7 feet wide by 9-1/2 feet long
column6: which he estimated would be about large enough to hold us. It took 34 yards
column7: 30 inches wide. Then we visited the village store to make our purchase. Canvas we found a little too expensive for us
column8: but a material called drill seemed about right. It cost ten cents a yard
column9: but since we wanted such a quantity of it the price was reduced to a total of $3.00. We repaired to the attic to lay out the material.
